title: Textile, 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: embroidery using counted stitches on plain weave
provenance: the slips were part of Margaret Simeon’s collection, sold at auction at Phillips, September 9th, 1992, lot 122.  Simeon was an important textile collector and lace scholar…she also taught, and wrote a book called The History of Lace (1979).
creditline: Musuem purchase through bequest of Ida McNeil in memory of Lincoln C. McNeil and Catherine McNeil
description: Four rows of yellow tulips on a cream-colored ground. Two tulips have been cut away.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 17th century.Medium: linen
Technique: embroidery using counted stitches on plain weave. Musuem purchase through bequest of Ida McNeil in memory of Lincoln C. McNeil and Catherine McNeil. 1992-168-1.
